alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 10:51AM EDT until July 11 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Montpelier affecting Washington County. For the Winooski River...including Moretown, Montpelier, Waterbury, Essex Junction...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Montpelier. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...Downtown Montpelier will continue to be inundated, and local roads will be covered by water until the level drops below 18 feet. Route 2 and railroad tracks along the river will continue to be covered with water, and widespread field flooding will continue throughout the Winooski River valley. This stage is equivalent to the FEMA 1 Percent Annual Chance Flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 21.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 21.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 6.8 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM EDT.
